entry.title: Kazakhstan's Former Security Chief Is Detained on Treason Charges
entry.content: More than 4,400 people, including foreign citizens, are being held in connection with protests venting frustration with the economy and closely controlled political system.

entry.title: For Dying Towns, the Pandemic Offers Challenges---and Hope
entry.content: For years, the mayors of many towns in Europe have struggled to prevent their communities from dying out as people have migrated to cities, schools have dwindled and businesses have died out.

entry.title: Mystery Surrounds Absence of Kazakhstan's Longtime Leader
entry.content: Since unrest started this week, the 81-year-old former president hasnâ€™t been seen in public and his successor has moved to undermine his authority.

entry.title: A Kidnapping Negotiator Gets His Biggest Test: Saving His Own Wife
entry.content: Abdullahi Tumburkai volunteers his time to help family, friends and neighbors bargain with kidnappers in what has become a crisis of abductions in Nigeria. One negotiation was especially harrowing.
